title: Hebrew Text Displays Incorrectly (RTL Issues)
content:
## Symptoms

When using Hebrew language mode:

**Layout issues:**
- Hebrew text appears but layout is incorrect
- Text aligned wrong direction (left instead of right)
- Menus on wrong side
- Icons not mirrored
- Buttons in English positions instead of mirrored

**Text rendering issues:**
- Hebrew characters appear as boxes ▢▢▢
- Reversed character order
- Mixed Hebrew and English text displays incorrectly
- Numbers in wrong positions

## Understanding RTL (Right-to-Left)

**What is RTL?**
- Hebrew reads right-to-left (RTL)
- English reads left-to-right (LTR)
- UI must mirror for RTL languages:
  - Menus move from left to right side
  - Buttons reorder right to left
  - Icons flip horizontally
  - Scrollbars move to left side

**Application RTL support:**
- Automatic RTL layout when Hebrew selected
- All UI elements should mirror
- Text direction changes automatically
- Bidirectional text (Hebrew + English) supported

## Common Causes

**Language not properly selected:**
- English mode active instead of Hebrew
- Language changed but app not restarted
- Settings not saved

**Windows language pack missing:**
- Hebrew language pack not installed
- Hebrew fonts not installed
- Regional settings not configured

**Font rendering issues:**
- Font doesn't support Hebrew characters
- Font rendering engine problem
- Outdated Windows font cache

**RTL layout not applied:**
- Application bug (rare)
- Cached layout from English mode
- Partial language switch

## Solutions

### Fix 1: Verify Hebrew Language Selected

**Check language setting:**

1. Click Settings (⚙️)
2. Go to **General** tab
3. Look at **Language Preferences**
4. Ensure **עברית (Hebrew)** is selected
5. If English is selected:
   - Click **עברית Hebrew**
   - UI should switch immediately

**Verify RTL layout applied:**
- Menus should be on RIGHT side
- Text should be right-aligned
- Buttons should read right-to-left

### Fix 2: Restart Application

**Full restart to re-apply RTL:**

1. Close application completely:
   - Right-click system tray icon
   - Select **יציאה (Exit)**
2. Wait 2-3 seconds
3. Launch application again
4. RTL layout should apply correctly

### Fix 3: Install Hebrew Language Pack

**Windows 10/11:**

1. Open Windows **Settings**
2. Go to **Time & Language**
3. Select **Language**
4. Click **Add a language**
5. Search for **Hebrew (עברית)**
6. Select **Hebrew** from list
7. Click **Next**
8. Check boxes:
   - ☑ Install language pack
   - ☑ Set as my Windows display language (optional)
9. Click **Install**
10. Wait for download and installation
11. Restart computer
12. Launch application

**Hebrew fonts included:**
- Arial
- David
- Gisha
- Levenim MT
- Miriam

### Fix 4: Clear Font Cache (If Characters Appear as Boxes)

**Windows font cache corruption:**

1. Close ALL applications
2. Open File Explorer
3. Navigate to: `C:\Windows\System32\`
4. Delete files (if they exist):
   - `FNTCACHE.DAT`
   - May require administrator permission
5. Restart computer
6. Windows rebuilds font cache
7. Launch application

**Alternatively, use built-in tool:**

1. Open Command Prompt as Administrator
2. Type: `sfc /scannow`
3. Wait for scan to complete
4. Restart computer

### Fix 5: Check for Application Updates

**RTL bugs fixed in updates:**

1. Settings > General > Updates
2. Click **Check Now**
3. If update available:
   - Download and install
   - Restart application
   - RTL improvements included

## Understanding Bidirectional Text

**Mixing Hebrew and English:**

Text like "PowerPoint 2024 בעברית" should display as:
- עברית (Hebrew) on the right
- PowerPoint 2024 (English) embedded within
- Overall flow right-to-left

**Numbers in RTL:**
- Numbers always display LTR (123, not 321)
- Even within Hebrew text
- This is correct behavior

**Punctuation:**
- Hebrew punctuation (״ ‟) used
- English punctuation within English words
- Direction-neutral punctuation (. , !) follows text direction

## Testing RTL Layout

**Visual checklist:**

☑ Menus on right side (not left)
☑ Settings icon on right (not left)
☑ Close button on left (not right)
☑ Text aligned right
☑ Bullet lists indented from right
☑ Scrollbars on left side
☑ Buttons ordered right-to-left
☑ Hebrew text readable (not boxes)

## Screenshots for Bug Reports

**If layout still incorrect:**

1. Take screenshot (Win+Shift+S)
2. Highlight specific issues:
   - Circle elements in wrong position
   - Arrow showing expected vs. actual
3. Include in bug report
4. See FAQ for bug reporting instructions

## When to Contact IT

- RTL layout doesn't apply after language change
- Hebrew characters display as boxes despite language pack
- Application crashes when switching to Hebrew
- Partial RTL (some elements mirrored, others not)
- Font rendering issues persist

## Known RTL Limitations

**Supported:**
- Full UI mirroring
- Hebrew text rendering
- Bidirectional text (Hebrew + English)
- All dialogs and panels

**Partial support:**
- Some technical terms kept in English
- Log files remain LTR
- Keyboard shortcuts unchanged (Ctrl+S, not Ctrl+ד)

**Not supported:**
- Other RTL languages (Arabic, Farsi) - only Hebrew
- Custom RTL fonts

## Prevention

**For Hebrew users:**

1. **Install Hebrew language pack first**
   - Before installing application
   - Ensures fonts available

2. **Select Hebrew during first-run wizard**
   - Applies RTL from the start
   - Avoids layout cache issues

3. **Keep Windows updated**
   - RTL improvements in updates
   - Font rendering fixes

> **Tip:** If Hebrew text looks incorrect, first verify Hebrew is selected in Settings > General > Language, then restart the application. This fixes 90% of RTL issues.
